title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9760.5 - Appeal from denial of access to records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9760.5 - Appeal from denial of access to records

State Regulations
(a) Any person who is denied access to any
record may, within 30 days of such denial, appeal the denial in writing to the
records appeals officer of the corporation at the public office address of that
officer. Upon receipt of an appeal, the records appeals officer shall
immediately forward a copy of such appeal to the Committee on Open Government, Department of State, 162 Washington Avenue, Albany, NY 12231. (b) The time for deciding an appeal shall
commence upon receipt of a written appeal identifying: (1)
the date of the request for
records; (2)
the records that were
denied; and
(3)
the name and return
address of the appellant. (c) The records appeals officer shall inform
the appellant and the Committee on Open Government, in writing, of the
corporation's determination within 10 business days of receipt of an
appeal. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
9760.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
